HEATH CITY COUNCIL

The Heath City Council consists of a Mayor and six Council Members who are elected at large. Click an image to email the Mayor or a Council Member.

MAYOR

Serving Since May 2024

City of Heath, TX

CITY COUNCIL MEETINGS

The City of Heath Council meet the second and fourth Tuesday of each month. Meetings occur in the Council Chambers at Heath City Hall, 200 Laurence Drive and typically begin at 6:30pm. Residents are encouraged to attend.

meets 1st Tuesday at 6:30 pm

James Tunnell, Chairman Wayne Gordon, Vice-Chairman Thomas Bishop Harry Heinkele Mike Rask Joe Ruszkiewicz Bob Shaw

– meets 3rd Monday at 6:00 pm

Justin Holland, Chairman John Walker, Vice-Chairman Bill Bromley David Vega Ben Fields Tom Herceg Joe Rubertino

The Park Board adopts and sets bylaws and establishes policies and procedures for proper administration of the parks and recreation program of the City subject to the approval of the City Council.

– meets 3rd Tuesday at 5:30 pm

Mike Zilinskas, Vice – Chairman Glen Hettinger Douglas Barkley Myles Hunter Richard Koepke David Lane Jeff Anderson Jeremiah McClure, ex-officio

The Heath EDC/MBC are nonprofit organizations that help new and existing businesses, and assists with workforce development. The organizations are funded by sales taxes approved by City voters.

– meets 4th Monday at 7:00 pm

Tami Hogan Jenni Knox Amanda Rosander Sandra Ownby Karen Myers

The Special Events Board is responsible for planning, funding, logistics, and execution of all City events. This includes annual citywide celebrations, ground breaking, grand openings and other one-of-a-kind events.

– meets monthly

Jason Thompson, Chairman Greg Ramey SuzAnne Howland Thomas Smith Douglas Hartman Richard Anderson Robert Farquharson Harriet Anderson, Alternate Lisa Reeves, Alternate

Christopher Boeck, Chairman Eric Harless Nathan Goodnight Phillip Hatfield Jimmy Lipinski Ira Berger, Alternate Dalton Tassett, Alternate James Sax, Alternate Joshua Small, Alternate

The Board of Adjustment is a quasi-judicial body that hears requests for variances to a City’s zoning ordinance and makes recommendations to City Council.

Joan Marshall Karen Koepke Joshua Small Lynn Tran Bart Davenport

The Take Area Appeals Panel review and decide on appeals related to regulatory matters within the Lake Ray Hubbard shoreline and make recommendations to City Council.

CLUB MUNICIPAL MGMT. DISTRICT No. 1

Mark Kennedy, President Norman Grunsfeld, Vice President James E. Sax, Secretary Leon Schieber, Assistant Secretary Alexis M. Lucas, Assistant Secretary Cody Baker, Ex-officio Mark Gonzales, Ex-officio

The Club Municipal Management District No. 1 is a special purpose district created by an act of the 82 Texas legislature in 2011 and is governed by a five member board of directors for Heath Golf and Yacht Club.

Brian Berry Justin Saunders Don Burrows Chris Shaw Eric Stacey Robert Swayze John Kenny

Interested in serving your community by volunteering for City Council appointed Boards and Commissions?
